title: Mistral Medium 3: A Cost-Efficient AI Powerhouse for Enterprise and Developers
summary: French AI startup Mistral is releasing a new AI model, Mistral Medium 3, that’s focused on efficiency without compromising performance. Available in Mistral’s API priced at $0.40 per million input tokens and $20.80 per million output tokens, Mistral Medium 3 performs “at or above” 90% of Anthropic’s costlier Claude Sonnet 3.7 model on “benchmarks across […]
full_text_content:
French AI startup Mistral is releasing a new AI model, Mistral Medium 3, that’s focused on efficiency without compromising performance.
Available in Mistral’s API priced at $0.40 per million input tokens and $20.80 per million output tokens, Mistral Medium 3 performs “at or above” 90% of Anthropic’s costlier Claude Sonnet 3.7 model on “benchmarks across the board,” claims Mistral. It also surpasses recent open models including Meta’s Llama 4 Maverick and Cohere’s Command A on popular AI performance evaluations.
Tokens are the raw bits of data models work with, with a million tokens equivalent to about 750,000 words (roughly 163,000 words longer than “War and Peace”).
“Mistral Medium 3 can […] be deployed on any cloud, including self-hosted environments of four GPUs and above,” explained Mistral in a blog post sent to TechCrunch. “On pricing, the model beats cost leaders such as DeepSeek v3, both in API and self-deployed systems.”
Mistral, founded in 2023, is a frontier model lab, aiming to build a range of AI-powered services including a chatbot platform, Le Chat, and mobile apps. It’s backed by VCs including General Catalyst, and has raised over €1.1 billion (roughly $1.24 billion) to date. Mistral’s customers include BNP Paribas, AXA, and Mirakl.
According to Mistral, Mistral Medium 3 is best for coding and STEM tasks, and excels at multimodal understanding. The company says that clients in financial services, energy, and healthcare have been beta testing the model for use cases like customer service, workflow automation, and analyzing complex data sets.
In addition to Mistral’s API, where enterprise customers can work with Mistral to fine-tune it, Mistral Medium 3 is available on Amazon’s Sagemaker platform starting Wednesday. It’ll soon come to other hosts, including Microsoft’s Azure AI Foundry and Google’s Vertex AI platforms, the company added.
Exhibit at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Secure your spot at TC Sessions: AI and show 1,200+ decision-makers what you’ve built — without the big spend. Available through May 9 or while tables last.
Exhibit at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Secure your spot at TC Sessions: AI and show 1,200+ decision-makers what you’ve built — without the big spend. Available through May 9 or while tables last.
The launch of Mistral Medium 3 follows on the heels of Mistral’s Mistral Small 3.1 in March. In its blog post, the company teased the release of a much larger model in the coming weeks.
Mistral on Wednesday also launched Le Chat Enterprise, a corporate-focused chatbot service that offers tools like an AI “agent” builder and integrates Mistral’s models with third-party services like Gmail, Google Drive, and SharePoint. Le Chat Enterprise rolled out in private preview earlier this year, but today marks its general availability.
Le Chat Enterprise will soon support MCP, Anthropic’s standard for connecting AI assistants to the systems and software where data resides. Other major AI model providers, including Google and OpenAI, announced that they would adopt MCP earlier this year.

seo_agent_results.generated_article_body_md:
## Mistral Medium 3: A Cost-Efficient AI Powerhouse for Enterprise and Developers French AI startup Mistral has unveiled **Mistral Medium 3**, its latest AI model, promising superior performance at a competitive price. Priced at $0.40 per million input tokens and $20.80 per million output tokens, Mistral claims the model outperforms 90% of Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 3.7 on benchmarks while surpassing open models like Meta’s Llama 4 Maverick and Cohere’s Command A. Designed for efficiency, Mistral Medium 3 excels in coding, STEM tasks, and multimodal understanding, making it a strong contender in enterprise AI solutions. ### Unpacking the Impact of Mistral Medium 3 Mistral Medium 3 is optimized for deployment across cloud and self-hosted environments, requiring just four GPUs—a cost-effective alternative to pricier competitors like DeepSeek v3. The model is already being tested in financial services, healthcare, and energy sectors for applications such as customer service automation and complex data analysis. Mistral, backed by over €1.1 billion in funding, is rapidly expanding its AI ecosystem. Alongside Mistral Medium 3, the company announced **Le Chat Enterprise**, a corporate chatbot service integrating third-party tools like Gmail and SharePoint. Future updates will include support for Anthropic’s MCP standard, aligning with industry leaders like OpenAI and Google. #### Pros & Cons
Pros
- **Cost-effective**: Priced lower than Claude Sonnet 3.7 while matching performance. - **Versatile deployment**: Works on cloud or self-hosted setups with minimal GPU requirements. - **Enterprise-ready**: Strong in coding, STEM, and multimodal tasks.
Cons
- **Limited availability**: Some integrations (e.g., Azure AI, Vertex AI) are still pending. - **Beta-stage reliance**: Some enterprise features are still in testing.
#### Frequently Asked Questions
How does Mistral Medium 3 compare to Claude Sonnet 3.7?

Mistral claims it matches or exceeds Claude Sonnet 3.7’s performance at a fraction of the cost, particularly in coding and STEM benchmarks.

Can Mistral Medium 3 be self-hosted?

Yes, it supports self-hosting on environments with four or more GPUs, offering flexibility for enterprises.
